subject: Music
title: Protest Songs That Changed History
description: A 60-second lesson on Protest Songs That Changed History.

hook.text: Some songs didn't just describe change â€” they caused it.

buildup.text: We Shall Overcome became the anthem of the American civil rights movement.

discovery.text: Billie Holiday's Strange Fruit described lynching so powerfully that it shocked audiences to action.

twist.text: Time magazine called Strange Fruit the song of the century â€” written by a Jewish schoolteacher.

climax.text: Protest songs give movements a voice that outlasts speeches and transcends borders.

punchline.text: A speech inspires a crowd. A song inspires a generation.

quiz.question: What did Billie Holiday's Strange Fruit describe?
options: The horror of racial lynching in America
